alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 3:24PM EDT until May 06 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Bell County in southeastern Kentucky... Northeastern Knox County in southeastern Kentucky... Southwestern Leslie County in southeastern Kentucky... Southeastern Clay County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 323 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Old Flat Lick, or near Pineville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Scalf around 330 PM EDT. Mills around 335 PM EDT. Erose around 340 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Beverly and Skidmore. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
